milestone: Sony introduces the Walkman, the first portable stereo. And CASSETTE sales continue to rise.
With the introduction of noise-free compact discs (CDs), the VINYL record begins a steep decline.
CDs outsell VINYL records for the first time.
Eight years after MTV goes on the air running around the clock music videos, debuting with 'Video Killed the Radio Star' in 1981, RIAA begins tracking MUSIC VIDEO sales.
CDs surpass CASSETTE tapes as the preferred medium for recorded music.
Napster transforms the music scene offering free music over the Internet without paying copyright fees. A court ruling prompts Napster to stop. Regardless, CD sales begin a steep decline.
Apple Computer introduces Apple iTunes Music Store, which allows people to DOWNLOAD SINGLES for 99 cents each.
The Spotify application launched on 7 October 2008 opening PAID SUBSCRIPTIONS to everyone.

VINYL records continue to make a strong comeback while CD and digital sales decline. According to Nielsen SoundScan, for the sixth consecutive year, the music industry sees an increase in VINYL sales.
